title.narrative: WASH Project for Iraqi IDPs in Mosul and Anbar

description.narrative: In anticipation of the operation to liberate Mosul City and the expected Due to Iraq crisis and significant displacement of IDPs in to the areas including the South parts of Iraq and KRI, all the humanitarian partners are trying to support the IDPs by providing the most basic requirements in WASH, food, shelter, protection and so on. Lack of resources is however constraining the work of the humanitarian partners. Through this application to IHPF, QRC will cover Establishing Disable WASH facilities in Khazir(M1), Khazir(M2), and Hassan Sham(U3) camps in Al-Hamdaniya District, Mosul Supply and installation of Disable latrines and showers to reach WASH Cluster minimum standards. Installation of Disable latrines and showers (to avoid protection issues). QRQ already using its available fund to cover first line in one of the Hassan Sham Camp in Khazir(M2) Camp (water trucking, waste collection, OampM of WASH facilities, hygiene promotion, Hygiene kits distribution... etc.) from the day the camp established and people arrived, the camp is (6,000 tents). All the proposed activities to IHPF will be implemented in duration of (3months). In Al-Hamdaniya District a lot of camps have been built due to military operation of Mosul, MoDM and UN agencies covered Shelter, installation of sanitation facilities for the camps. The additional work by QRC will assure that WASH facilities are accessible for the people with special needs in the camp, and that WASH facilities will be developed according to the WASH Cluster Standards, which are aligned to the Sphere standards. In developing this proposal QRC has aligned interventions to the “Draft WASH Response against Settlement Typology” and “Minimum Action on Gender in Emergency in Iraq” that has been shared by WASH Cluster as a part of MOSUL CONTINGENCY PLANNING. Close coordination of QRC with local authorities and also humanitarian partners of the area will be followed during implementation of the work. QRC will select the contractor thru tender bidding with full transparency. Selecting of contractor will not going to depend on the lowest price only, it will depend on the quality of the work and materials also. QRC field team will monitor/supervise the work of the contractor daily and will report to the management about any challenges and difficulties in the site. Same time the logistic team with close coordination of the project manager will ensure the quality of the materials will be provided to the IDPs. With this approach of providing the basic WASH requirements and needs, IDPs especially people with special needs (Disabilities), pregnant women, and children will feel safe and can use the WASH facilities with dignity, because in each area disable latrines and showers will going to be provided and privacy screening will going to be installed for female disable latrines and showers, this will reduce the cases of GBVs and violence. Also this approach will reduce the cases of spreading diseases and cholera by providing the WASH facilities for peoples with special needs.
